newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Graboplast extends gain on weaker Budapest.
newsitem.headline: Graboplast extends gain on weaker Budapest.

text.p: Hungarian share prices closed lower on the Budapest Stock Exchange as reflected by the BUX index, but the market, lacking fresh incentive, remained trendless, traders said.

"Trading was going calmly without anything special," said Laszlo Lakatos of Bank Austria-GiroCredit Befektetesi Rt. "The appearance of one or two major buyers or sellers is enough to move prices to either sides," he said.
The BUX index ended at 3,339.32 points, down 20.22. BUX futures closed lower for all maturities. Spot share turnover totalled 607.3 million forints.
Oil company MOL weakened 10 forints to end at 1,540, on what traders explained by uncertainties on energy price increase delays.
The Hungarian government announced last week that it postponed the energy price increase until January 1, 1997 from October 1, 1996.
Home improvement product maker Graboplast firmed to close at 3,975 forints, up 115, on what traders explained with the complete lack of supply.
Brewery Martfu firmed almost 10 percent or 175 forints to end at 2,000 forints in only two deals.
Chemical company TVK put on five forints to end at 1,340 forints, but traders doubted the paper could move away from its recent narrow price range due to strong supply.
"The share seems unable to move out of the recent price range, despite the fact it is cheap," Lakatos said. Traders blamed the strong supply, mainly from abroad.
